info.title: Open Data API
info.description: Latest Swagger specification for OpenData Commercial Credit Card

tags.name: CCC
tags.description: Endpoint for getting Commercial Credit Card data

get.description: Gets a list of all `Commerical Credit Card` objects.

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since
parameters.description: Used for conditional request, to retrieve data only if modified since a given date

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Used for conditional request, to retrieve data only if the given Etag value does not match

200.description: Successful response with a list of `Commercial Credit Card` data

Etag.description: A unique ID identifying whether this resource has changed

Cache-Control.description: Describes how long this response can be cached

X-Frame-Options.description: Prevent this request from being loaded in any iframes

X-Content-Type-Options.description: Ensures each page has a content type and prevents browsers from doing MIME type sniffing

enum: Use of the APIs and any related data will be subject to the terms of the Open Licence and subject to terms and conditions

Brand.description: Brand registered by the banking group at https://register.fca.org.uk/
Brand.title: Brand

items.description: Brand registered by the banking group at https://register.fca.org.uk/

BrandName.description: Brand Name that an organisation uses to market its products or services to a consumer as registered at https://register.fca.org.uk/
BrandName.title: BrandName

CCC.description: CCC means a Commercial Credit Card.
CCC.title: CCC

items.description: CCC means a Commercial Credit Card.

Name.description: The name of the CCC product used for marketing purposes from a customer perspective. I.e. what the customer would recognise.
Name.title: Name

Identification.description: The unique ID that has been internally assigned by the financial institution to each of the Commercial Credit Card products they market to their retail and/or small to medium enterprise (SME) customers.
Identification.title: Identification

Segment.description:
Market segmentation is a marketing term referring to the aggregating of prospective buyers into groups, or segments, that have common needs and respond similarly to a marketing action. Market segmentation enables companies to target different categories of consumers who perceive the full value of certain products and services differently from one another.

Read more: Market Segmentation http://www.investopedia.com/terms/m/marketsegmentation.asp#ixzz4gfEEalTd
Follow us: Investopedia on Facebook

With respect to CCC products, they are segmented in relation to different markets that they wish to focus on.
Segment.title: Segment

items.description:
Market segmentation is a marketing term referring to the aggregating of prospective buyers into groups, or segments, that have common needs and respond similarly to a marketing action. Market segmentation enables companies to target different categories of consumers who perceive the full value of certain products and services differently from one another.

Read more: Market Segmentation http://www.investopedia.com/terms/m/marketsegmentation.asp#ixzz4gfEEalTd
Follow us: Investopedia on Facebook

With respect to CCC products, they are segmented in relation to different markets that they wish to focus on.

Repayment.title: Repayment

MinBalanceRepaymentRate.title: MinBalanceRepaymentRate

MinBalanceRepaymentAmount.title: MinBalanceRepaymentAmount

Notes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the Repayment details.

OtherFeeType.title: OtherFeeType

items.description: Other fee type code which is not available in the standard code set

Code.description: The four letter Mnemonic used within an XML file to identify a code
Code.title: Code

Name.description: Long name associated with the code
Name.title: Name

Description.description: Description to describe the purpose of the code
Description.title: Description

ProductURL.description: URL provided by the organisation which redirects to the product (on live products only) available on an external website. There might be more than one product at a given URL.
ProductURL.title: ProductURL

ProductDescription.description: The description of the CCC product used for marketing purposes from a customer perspective. I.e. what the customer would recognise.
ProductDescription.title: ProductDescription

TcsAndCsURL.description: URL provided by the financial institution which redirects to the CCC T&Cs on an external website
TcsAndCsURL.title: TcsAndCsURL

MaxDailyCardWithdrawalLimit.description: The maximum amount of money that you can withdraw per day (so long as you do not exceed your available credit limit)
MaxDailyCardWithdrawalLimit.title: MaxDailyCardWithdrawalLimit

MinCreditLimit.description: The minimum amount of credit that the bank will offer against the card account
MinCreditLimit.title: MinCreditLimit

MaxCreditLimit.description: The maximum amount of credit that the bank will offer against the card account and is normally “subject to status”
MaxCreditLimit.title: MaxCreditLimit

MaxPurchaseInterestFreeLengthDays.description: The maximum number of days that you have between making a purchase via the credit card and having to repay the balance without incurring interest charges
MaxPurchaseInterestFreeLengthDays.title: MaxPurchaseInterestFreeLengthDays

SalesAccessChannels.description: Channels via which a customer can open a CCC.
SalesAccessChannels.title: SalesAccessChannels

items.description: Channels via which a customer can open a CCC.

ServicingAccessChannels.description: Channels via which customers can access CCC services.
ServicingAccessChannels.title: ServicingAccessChannels

items.description: Channels via which customers can access CCC services.

ContactlessIndicator.description: Indicates whether the card can be used with a contactless terminal
ContactlessIndicator.title: ContactlessIndicator

PeriodicFee.description: Charge made on a periodic basis for the card account e.g. Annual Fee
PeriodicFee.title: PeriodicFee

PeriodicFeePeriod.description: The unit of period (days, weeks, months etc.) of the Periodic Fee
PeriodicFeePeriod.title: PeriodicFeePeriod

APR.description: Annual Percentage Rate (APR) is a measure that attempts to calculate what percentage of the principal you’ll pay per period (in this case a year), taking every charge – monthly payments over the course of the loan, upfront fees, etc. – into account. For commercial credit cards, this APR is the representative APR which includes any account fees.
APR.title: APR

Notes.description: Free text for adding details for core product.
Notes.title: Notes

OtherCardScheme.description: Other card scheme which is not available in the standard code list
OtherCardScheme.title: OtherCardScheme

items.description: Other card scheme which is not available in the standard code list
